name: Demon
info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by 10%.
maniaIntensifyText: All allied Sinners on the field will gain an Attack increase equal to 0.5% of their Shield Value.
criminalRecord:
The suspect for attempted murder of the to-be Speaker of the City Council Abel Schilder at the City Council election speech, then violently resisted arrest, severely injuring dozens of Special Task Force members. In the following several years, the subject continued to carry out assaults against officials of the City Council, and was never caught.

--

An anonymous source reveals that the DisCity Councilor serial murder case contains multiple discrepancies, such as the use of Mania weapons and the severe disfiguring mutation of the corpses. The 9th Agency's investigation has confirmed that the case is related to Parma and corrupt city councilors. The subject suffered a certain degree of false accusation and was followed by hired assassins for several years.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
With the strategic shield, hostile attacks can be warded off within a short period and morale of allies can be effectively boosted. These effects are especially effective on Demon himself.

+++* Awakening Signs
The subject's ability awakened at the scene of Abel's murder. This case consists of many suspicious details. The reports suggest that the subject erupted in intense rage and hatred at the time, but more details are to be verified in future interrogations.

+++* Corruption State
All cognitive assessments and physical examinations have returned normal results. The subject's corruption level is low and his mind is clear, with no physical signs of mutation detected.
ecbFlavourText:
"I'm sorry Abel. I failed to protect you."
"I'm sorry Vera. I failed to keep my promise."
interrogation1:
Prior to the interrogation, the Chief meets with a city councilor, who explains that a trial will be held for Demon in thirty days. In addition to various files, they receive one last piece of evidence: a small charm bracelet. When asked what it pertains to, the city councilor replies that it should be useful in making Demon talk. Despite his restraints, Demon's force of presence is extremely intimidating in the interrogation room. As the Chief goes through the list of his victims, including Abel Schilder, his foster father, he bluntly admits to all of his crimes. When asked for his motivations, he replies that they were all done out of revenge, but refuses to elaborate what for. The Chief produces the bracelet, hoping for answers, but Demon suddenly grows violent. He demands to know where they got it, and when the Chief answers that it was the city council, Demon easily breaks his restraints and attempts to attack them. Nightingale, standing behind the Chief, hits Demon with a high power tranquilizer, instantly sedates him. As his consciousness fades, he mumbles the name "Vera."

Demon's reaction today only adds more mysteries to the case. Though we have enough evidence to prove him guilty, we still have no idea what his motives are.This is especially true considering his unusual reaction to the bracelet at the end. The city council claimed that he was a cold-blooded, murderous psychopath, but what you saw suggested otherwise. Further investigation is required.
interrogation2:
Two weeks later, the Chief enters Demon's cell to continue from where the interrogation left off, but he catches them off guard. He knocks them unconscious, kidnaps them, and flees the Bureau. Upon awaking in a dingy apartment room, the Chief, realizing that Demon didn't strip them of their tracking beacon, attempts to question him in an attempt to buy time until backup arrives. Demon explains he while he technically did kill Abel Schilder, he only did so after gangsters broke in and attacked with Mania weapons, causing him to mutate into a Corruptor. Knowing that Abel had upset other politicians in his bid for election, Demon gathers that this was done by the City Council in an attempt to sabotage his campaign. He confirmed this from his tortured victims, all of whom were connected to the Council in some way. As the Chief attempts to break free from their restraints, the bracelet falls out of their pocket. Demon, demeanor softening once again, takes it, and the Chief asks if it belonged to Vera Schilder, Abel's biological daughter. Demon confirms this, saying that he assumes the council has kidnapped her and intends to use her as leverage against him in the trial. Although the Chief tries to convince him that they can help, Demon thanks them for their kindness, saying it won't last long in a world like this, and says that he has to go it alone. At that moment, a member of the 9th Agency interrupts, having already stealthily entered the room some time ago. Although both the Chief and Demon are hesitant to trust him, he explains that he has a plan to turn the trial in their favor, and that all he requires is their cooperation.

An unexpected man, claiming to be a member of the 9th Agency, reveals a plan to you and Demon. Having second thoughts, Demon hesitates to give an answer. Then, Nightingale arrives with forces and puts him down with an anesthesia shot. This time, you make a decision for him. The MBCC raised Demon's security level once more. But you know that this measure is no longer necessary. Demon now cooperates with you willingly. Following the request of that strange man, each of you is now making preparation. The trial day comes as planned.
interrogation3:
The day of the trial arrives. The city councilor from before serves as the prosecutor, and as the trial goes on, it is clear from his and the judge's behavior that there was never an intention for this trial to be fair. Even after Demon tries to explain the situation with Vera, the councilor produces testimony speaking out against Demon, supposedly signed by the girl herself. Despite the Chief's best attempts, it seems that the trial is lost. Then, the man from the 9th Agency speaks up. He reveals that upon investigating the City Council's involvement with [[[Black Water]]], the Agency discovered that Vera Schilder has been dead for six years. Demon grows despondent as the trial quickly comes to a close, with the Chief realizing that the two of them have played exactly into the 9th Agency's hand. As the 9th Agency attempts to take the judge away, Demon asks why he lied about Vera. He replies, more or less, that it's just how their world works. In a fit of rage, Demon snaps his restraints and slams the judge's head against the floor, killing him instantly. The man from the 9th Agency sighs, warning the Chief that Demon is "an unstable pawn," and the Chief ensures him that this incident will be thoroughly covered up.

No one expected that the trial would end in such a disastrous way. There is now a purge in the city council, starting from its superior executives to the subordinates. It seems the 9th Agency's work is seeing progress. As for Demon, now that the city council is busy saving its own skin, the MBCC will be his final destination. Carrying the burden of his past sins and the brutal crime of murdering the city council's judge on site, he will have to fight for the MBCC until one day a Corruptor or something more horrible takes his life. There is no parole, no commutation, but only a fate grimmer than death.
interrogation4:
Some time later, the MBCC launches a mission to find Vera's remains, and Demon applies to be put on the task force. Despite the other soldiers unwilling to trust him, the Chief's confidence in him has not wavered. As Demon tears apart Corruptors, he collapses a building, shielding him and the Chief from the debris but cutting them off from the rest of the squad. The two investigate the ruins, finding that this matches the location, and discover a room with a closed door, outside of which are clear signs of a prior investigation. The Chief offers that Demon go in alone, but he says he doesn't need the privacy. The two enter the room and find Vera's body, now just a skeleton, along with her notebook. As Demon gathers the remains and says his final prayers, the sound of Corruptors mounts around them, forcing them to flee. Once outside, Demon realizes that they're too close to a residential area, and that if left unattended, the Corruptors will no doubt run rampant. Insisting that the FAC won't arrive in time, Demon demands that the Chief leave him behind to hold them off himself. The Chief promises to return with reinforcements, and as they run off, Demon mumbles that he should just be left to die. Demon holds off the swarm in a gory display of his strength, but even for all his abilities and enhanced regeneration, his stamina begins to falter. He starts to be distracted by memories of Abel and Vera; how he met them, conversations that he had with Vera, a surprise party she held for him, how he promised her that he would protect their father. As he fights on, growing weaker, Vera's notebook falls out of his breast pocket, revealing her final letter to him. Although she suspected she would soon be killed, she reaffirmed her love for him, supporting him regardless of the path he took. Demon collapses, blacking out. In a blur of semi-unconsciousness, he hears the Chief's voice saying that they came back, that they brought reinforcements. Overcome by his injuries and the weight of his guilt, he does not get up.

Demon is not dead. But no one can bring him salvation.
arrestRec1: The subject escaped the Special Task Force's siege and was on the run for years, during which he violently resisted arrest repeatedly. The MBCC and FAC joined forces to send out a large number of police officers and eventually arrested the subject after making a great deal of sacrifice.
arrestRec2: Demon Schilder, formerly named Demon Borne, was born in Syndicate. In N.F. 95, Demon was adopted by councilor Abel Schilder and later became a captain of the Special Task Force under the FAC.
arrestRec3: During the time when he was the FAC's Special Task Force's captain, Demon was proactive with his duties and helped Abel gain support from a considerable portion of Eastside's population. After the incident, the subject was struck off and besieged by the Special Task Force.
arrestRec4: Investigation shows that the real culprit of Abel's death is an opposition party. During the election speech, Abel was showing signs of mutation after being attacked by a Mania Weapon, and the subject had no choice but to end his life. A family member, Vera Schilder, was kidnapped by Parma lab after the incident, and is now confirmed to be dead.
servingTerm1: Possesses excellent shooting and wrestling skills and is well-known for that, so is frequently challenged by other Sinners. When this kind of situation occurs, no need to alert security, as the row will typically be resolved within five minutes. When it's over, please be reminded to notify the medical staff.
servingTerm2: Pretty receptive to media such as novels, comics, music, and films. Mostly spends his free time reading literary works. Since the subject spent most of his energy on fighting at work in the past, he hasn't yet found any hobbies he's passionate about.
servingTerm3: Demon is especially patient and kind toward younger Sinners, and does not usually strike back directly when encountering those Sinners' provocations and attacks. He even tries to catch up on those young Sinners' fashion and interests despite finding it very hard to chime in on these discussions.
servingTerm4: Having always thought his presence will bring bad luck to people around him, the subject's tendency of self-destruction is getting more serious after having learned about Vera's death. The only time this tendency is under control is when battling together with the Chief.

supervision1:
++* âš  Application

//Demon the Sinner hands over an application form.//

**System Notifications:** Demon the Sinner requested to replace his broken armor and equipment.

* **Prompt:** Approve
supervision2:
++* âš  Capture

//Demon the Sinner hands over an operation report.//

**System Notifications:** Demon the Sinner turned in the loots he confiscated during the operation.

* **Prompt:** Take
supervision3:
++* âš âš  Training

//Demon is firing real bullets in the Training Room's shooting range to train himself.//

**System Notifications:** Gunshots come from the shooting range. Someone is practicing their marksmanship there.

**System Notifications:** Bang, bang, bang, bang, bang, bangâ€”

**System Notifications:** Auto Rating System: Your final score is 91.

* **Prompt:** Compliment Demon

**Chief:** I didn't expect you had such a good aim. Why don't you use a gun in combat?

**Demon:** ...Small caliber guns don't deal much damage to Corruptors.

* **Prompt:** Then why practice shooting?

**Demon:** Better safe than sorry.

**Chief:** It's already pretty good.

**System Notifications:** Bang, bang, bang, bang, bang, bangâ€”

**System Notifications:** Auto Rating System: Your final score is 93.5.

**Chief:** Indeed. Skills can grow weak without practice. It's like... you'll lose important things if you don't protect them.

**Demon:** ...

**Demon:** Uh huh.

**System Notifications:** Bang, bang, bang, bang, bang, bangâ€”

**System Notifications:** Auto Rating System: Your final score is 98.
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Vending Machine

//Something seems wrong with the vending machine.//

**System Notifications:** The vending machine is making beeping sounds, drawing attention from people around it.

* **Prompt:** Check

**Chief:** What's the matter? Is it broken?

**Demon:** ...

**Demon:** Are you in a hurry?

**Demon:** Well then, stand back.

**System Notifications:** (Thud) The vending machine's indicator blinked a few times and dropped the snacks.

**Chief:** That... That is impressive.

**Demon:** Here you are.

* **Prompt:** Is there a special trick to it?

**Demon:** No.

**Demon:** This happened to the FAC's vending machine before. Just hit it a few times and it's fixed.

**Chief:** Thank you.

**Demon:** ...You're welcome.
supervision5:
++* âš âš âš  Mission Request

//Demon seems a bit irritated during the regular hypnotherapy session.//

**System Notifications:** Demon seems a bit irritated during the regular hypnotherapy session.

* **Prompt:** Ask

**Chief:** Something wrong?

**Demon:** You haven't assigned missions to me for a while.

**Demon:** Why?

**Chief:** Even you need some rest from time to time. Endless combat will take its toll on your mind and body.

**Demon:** I don't need it.

* **Prompt:** Do you have a death wish?

**Demon:** ...Death?

**Demon:** That might be a good thing. I have nothing left to care about in this city.

**Demon:** You are going to clear out an abandoned Parma facility today, aren't you?

**Demon:** Take me with you. Your team will need a vanguard.

* **Prompt:** Approve
 * **Chief:** Go get your gears and get ready to head out.
 * **Demon:** ...Yes.

* **Prompt:** Reject
 * **Chief:** I am not taking you with me.
 * **Chief:** You are going to take three days off, and that's an order. For now, you are not going anywhere.
 * **Demon:** ...Chief, you are a "good person."
 * **Demon:** Unfortunately, good people don't last very long in this place.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Shield Stolen

//Demon the Sinner lost his shield to a thief. Investigate immediately.//

**System Notifications:** Demon the Sinner lost his shield to a thief. Investigate immediately.

* **Prompt:** Ask Demon

**Chief:** When was the last time you saw that shield?

**Demon:** ...

**Demon:** An hour ago.

**Chief:** What have you been doing during this one hour?

**Demon:** Training.

**Chief:** Which means someone stole your shield from the dressing room during that one hour while you were practicing in the Training Room, correct?

**Demon:** I placed the shield in front of the Training Room and didn't take it with me into the dressing room.

**Chief:** You didn't put the shield in a locker?

**Demon:** It wouldn't fit.

* **Prompt:** Check surveillance

**System Notifications:** The surveillance footage shows that [[[Demolia]]] took the shield and just walked away.

* **Prompt:** Ask Demolia

**Chief:** Demolia, why did you steal Demon's shield?

**Demolia:** Huh? I didn't know it belonged to Demon.

**Demolia:** I thought it was a metal scrap that no one needed. I was planning to sell it for money.

**Demolia:** Sorry, bro.

**Demon:** It's okay.

* **Prompt:** Warn Demolia

**Chief:** Though the owner doesn't mind it, our rules call for a punishment...

**Demolia:** Huh? No, please don't.

* **Prompt:** Punish her
 * **Chief:** You will be cleaning the Bureau's Depot for a day.
 * **Demolia:** Really? And do you think it would be possible if you give me the scraps you don't need?
 * **Chief:** ...

* **Prompt:** Let her go
 * **Chief:** I'll let it slide this time, but not again.
 * **Demolia:** Oh, that's great. I'll be heading back now.
 * **Demon:** Thank you.
 * **Prompt:** You have no reason to thank me.
 * **Demon:** You helped me get back my shield, and...
 * **Demon:** I owe Demolia a huge favor. It will make me feel bad if she has to face punishment.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
It's not the first time I've been locked up in a place of this sort... Come on, show me how you're going to torture me this time! What kind of crime did those maggots assign to me again?

[Raise to Phase 1]
The price has been paid. This is the power I deserve.

[Raise to Phase 3]
It's time. I must fulfill my promise.

[Level Start]
Operation ON. Everyone stay alert.

[Win Battles]
Enemy targets cleared. Operation still on. Stay on your guard.

[Lose Battles]
Haha... In the end, I've been able to protect nothing and no one.

[Ultimate Skill]
Don't dream of getting past me!

[Die in Battles]
I've... let you down...

[Greeting]
Corruptors, thugs and conspirators are still rampaging through the city... You should act now.

[Conversation 1]
Maggots have infested this city, pulling strings to manipulate everyone. I want them dead.

[Conversation 2]
Never underestimate the darkness lurking beneath this city. That's a lesson that's cost me everything.

[Conversation 3]
I should have died on the streets like other Syndicans, but Abel took me from that place. Looking back now, it might have been a mistake...

[Special Conversation 1]
It's been eight years. and nothing has changed in the DisCity. Abel, together with his dream, has completely disappeared from people's memories. Sometimes I wonder, what do they actually remember?

[Special Conversation 2]
Murdering your own... father, your long-time subordinates, burying everything you cherish... You want to know what thats feels like? Haha, you won't like it.

[Special Conversation 3]
Fighting alongside you might be the only sensible choice I've made my whole life.

[Full Compliance]
Those whom I could call friends are all gone now. Try to... stay alive for a bit longer. Don't die before me.

[Idle]
Abel, Vera... I won't let you down... not again...

[Annoyed]
Tungsten carbide armors are indeed very useful. If you like it, you should get one for yourself too.

[Special Attention]
Are you monitoring me? Or... do you need someone to protect your safety?

[Dispatch]
Mission received. Drawing up an operation plan now.

[Dispatch Complete]
Mission accomplished. After-action report submitted.

[Level Up]
I can endure more.

[Pat Head]
I... dislike that.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
How much longer do we still need to stay here? "We need to wait for a reply?" Sigh, alright... in case of an emergency, you can order me to do anything.

[Greeting]
Time to act. It's easy to lose yourself in this kind of fun. I don't want you to get addicted.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
The dirtiest places hold the most precious intelligence. I agree with you on this point. But... I still need some time to get used to these blinding neon lights.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Fight side by side? In such a tiny space, it's best that I handle anything that might happen. 

[Idle] 
...Stay away, I'm waiting for my... companion to come back.

[Annoyed]
...We're still on a mission. No time for these distractions.

[Special Attention] 
I'll keep you safe and sound so you can complete the mission. I hope you muster enough courage and don't waste too much time.

[Level Up}
I don't need to stand out.
nightmareTalent: For every Sinner in the exploration team, all allied units gain a 3% Max HP boost.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Treacherous Beast
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: New Exclusive Ultimate [Shield of Flesh]. Demon activates [Shield of Flesh] to convert 5% of his Max HP into his shield per second, stacking up to 50% / 60% / 70%  of his Max HP. This conversion stops when maximum is reached or Demon's HP is not enough. When Demon moves, the effect expires. [Shield of Flesh] can be used only once per battle.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"I'm sorry Abel. I failed to protect you."
"I'm sorry Vera. I failed to keep my promise."

maniaIntensify.title: Determined Encouragement
maniaIntensify.text: All allied Sinners on the field will gain an Attack increase equal to 0.5% of their Shield Value.

crimebrandSets.name: High HP
crimebrandSets.note: Increase his max hp as well as preventing him from taking damage.

crimebrandSets.name: TOA Shield Stack
crimebrandSets.note: Exclusively used for Shield Stack to keep him ulting and have his shield stay up.

shackles.title: Shield Strike
shackles.description: [Shield Combat] deals (shield value * 5%) damage, up to 150% of Attack.

shackles.title: Lonely Guardian
shackles.description: [Frontline Defense] applies a bonus effect: For each allied Sinner within range, Demon gains a shield equal to 5% of his Max HP.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Shield Combat
skills.description: Demon attacks with his shield, dealing (Attack*110%) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Frontline Defense
skills.description: Demon gains a (22% of Max HP) shield and grants each allied Sinner within range a shield equaling to 35% of Demon's total Shield Value. The shields last 12 seconds.

skills.name: Battle Persistence
skills.description: Demon gains a (10% of his Max HP) shield. The shield effect resets every 20 seconds.

skills.name: Never Give Up
skills.description: For every 20% HP Demon loses, his Shield Efficiency is increased by 7%. This effect is at max when Demon's HP is below 20%.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Health +85, Defense +8
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Health +85, Defense +8, Unlock Mission: Dispatch Demon 2 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Mission: Replace Demon - Upgrade to Outdoor Supervision Object
Unlock voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Title
